question: A 66-year-old woman is complaining of abdominal pain, constipation. In the past, she underwent renal stone surgery. On examination, her blood pressure (BP) is 145/77 mmHg and her pulse is 98 beats/min. Her fasting glucose and kidney function tests are normal but her calcium is found to be elevated at 13.05 mg/dL. What is the most likely cause of her hypercalcemia?

Students of 2nd-year MBBS are given a slide of the pancreas for study. The endocrine part shows islets of Langerhans with different types of cells. What cells of the pancreas secrete pancreatic polypeptide?

A 35-year-old lady presents with complaints of heat intolerance, weight loss, and swelling in front of the neck. She is also found to have bilaterally protruded eyes. What is the most appropriate terminology used for the protruded eyes in this patient?
An old lady living alone has locked her room door, but she keeps checking whether the door is locked or not every 5 minutes. Which of the following conditions is she most likely to be suffering from?
What is the insulin preparation of choice in diabetic ketoacidosis?

A young patient comes to the emergency room (ER) with intense thirst and dehydration, a blood sugar of 608 mg/dl, serum osmolarity of 300 mOsmol/kg, and pH of 7.1. He is breathing rapidly and his breath emits a fruity smell. What is the diagnosis based on these findings?

A 38-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a history of end-stage renal disease secondary to hypertension. She has undergone dialysis 3 times weekly for the last 5 years and her medical records show progressive elevation of calcium levels over the last year. On physical examination, Body Mass Index (BMI) is 22.5 kg/m², blood pressure (BP) is 145/98 mmHg, and pulse rate is 91 beats/min. Laboratory test results: total calcium= 11.9 mg/dL (8.2-10 .2 mg/dL), phosphorus= 6.7 mg/dL (2.3-4.7 mg/dL), creatinine = 9.3 mg/dL (0.6-1.1 mg/dL), alkaline phosphatase = 1181 U/L (50-120 U/L). What is the most likely cause of her hypercalcemia?
Which of the following hormones is secreted in large quantities from the zona fasciculata of the adrenal gland?

A 25-year-old lady presents to the endocrine clinic with complaints of weight loss, excessive sweating, tachycardia, and tremors. She was diagnosed with hyperthyroidism after some laboratory investigations. What is the most appropriate cause of tremors in this patient?

A 30-year-old woman presents to the clinic with palpitations, weight loss, and excessive sweating for almost 5-6 months. She cannot concentrate on carrying out her daily activities especially looking after her children. Recently, she also developed pain in both eyes and her friend told her that one of her eyes has become more prominent than the other. What is the most likely cause of her condition?

A man, charged with murder, pleaded insanity in a court of law. He was brought before the medical officer for examination. How will the medical officer differentiate between true and feigned insanity?

answers.option: In feigned insanity the onset is gradual
In feigned insanity fatigue does not set in
In feigned insanity the person appreciates repeated examination
In feigned insanity behavioral disturbances are uniform
In feigned insanity peculiar facial expressions are absent

question: A 35-year-old lady is diagnosed with autoimmune hypothyroidism. Her physician was concerned about thyroid auto-antibodies. Which of the following is the most appropriate antibody to detect the autoimmune thyroid disease?

A 26-year-old woman is complaining of an abnormal tingling sensation in her hands and feet. For the last 2 years, a neurologist is treating her for a seizure disorder. On examination, her blood pressure (BP) is 125/77 mmHg and her pulse is 98 beats/min. Her investigations show: calcium = 6.5 (7.5-8.5 mg/dL), phosphate = 4.8 (2.5-4.0 mg/dL). What is the most likely cause of her hypocalcemia?

A 23-year-old woman, nulliparous, tests positive for anti-thyroid peroxidase antibodies and has symptoms consistent with hypothyroidism including constipation, fatigue, dry skin, and weight gain. Which of these conditions is she most likely to have?
A 35-year-old woman undergoes a successful thyroidectomy but develops neck swelling and dyspnea soon after the surgery. What is the next best step in management?

answers.option: Urgent transfer to the operating theatre

question: A person diagnosed with type 1 diabetes mellitus develops ketoacidosis. What is the first step in management?
An asthmatic individual who is on regular therapy for the past year develops symptoms of Cushing's syndrome. What is the most likely etiology?
A 6-year-old child presents with signs and symptoms of adrenal insufficiency. He also has a long history of mucocutaneous candidiasis. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 7-year-old boy comes to the clinic for evaluation of short stature. He is shorter than his peers. His bone age is 4 years and his height is equivalent to that in a 5-year-old child(3rd percentile). No chronic diseases run in the family. Laboratory investigations reveal no abnormal findings. What is the most likely reason for his short stature?
What is the mechanism of action of propylthiouracil (PTU)?
What is the marked macrovascular complication of type 2 diabetes mellitus?
A 45-year-old female presented with a nodule in her thyroid region. What is the most common thyroid carcinoma in this age group?
What is the most common source of ectopic adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) production?

A 54-year-old, married woman para-2 comes to the clinic with the complaint of weight gain and lethargy for the past 3 months. She had her last menstrual period 6 years back. Her blood pressure is 150/90 mmHg, her pulse is 65/min, and is regular bilaterally. Her body mass index (BMI) falls in the obese range. Her eyes are puffy, she complains of breathlessness, and cold intolerance, her skin is coarse and her abdomen has white striations present. What is the best diagnostic test for this woman?

answers.option: Oral glucose tolerance test and TSH

question: A man is brought to the district hospital after being bitten by a snake on foot. He complained of localized pain and swelling of the foot. He then started bleeding through his mouth and nose. On examination, petechial hemorrhage could be seen under his skin. He got bitten by which type of snake?
A young boy is brought to the hospital in a state of shock and fright after being bitten by a cobra on hand. What is the next step of management after reassuring the patient?

answers.option: Wash the wound with soap and water

question: A 25-year-old lactating female comes to the office with a painful swelling on her left breast for the last 5 days and fever for the last 2 days. The swelling has enlarged progressively with increasing pain. On examination, the swelling is located in the left upper quadrant, is erythematous, soft, and tender. What is the most likely diagnosis?

An infant presents to the outpatient department with complaints of lethargy, difficulty in feeding, and constipation for the past 1 month. On examination, the baby has a protruded tongue, husky cry, and an umbilical hernia. Laboratory results show an increased level of TSH and reduced levels of free T4. What is the most likely diagnosis?

An 11-year-old girl has a short stature and increased weight. She also complains of cold intolerance and increased sleep. Her bone age is delayed. Lab results show an increased level of TSH and a reduced free T4. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which part of the anterior pituitary secretes most of the hormones?

A 28-year-old woman presents to the endocrine clinic with secondary amenorrhea and galactorrhoea for the last 6 months. Her general physical and systemic examination is normal. Lab investigations reveal, prolactin = 3250 mU/L (60–620), free T4 = 15.5 pmol/L (11.5–22.7), thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) = 2.5 mU/L (0.35–5.5), and urine pregnancy test is negative. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the mechanism of action of methimazole?

answers.option: Prevent binding of iodine to thyroglobulin

question: Which drug increases insulin sensitivity by increasing peripheral receptors for insulin?

A 19-year-old girl is brought to the emergency room by her family who reports that she swallowed a liquid poison in a suicide attempt. On examination, she is bradycardic, hypotensive, flaccid, has excessive salivation, and has convulsions and fasciculations. What is the likely cause of poisoning?
A woman taking corticosteroids for chronic interstitial lung disease (ILD) develops moon facies and weakness. Her lung functions have improved over time. What is the most appropriate management?

A young male patient is suffering from a delusional belief where he imagines that he is going to be poisoned by his relatives, wife, and son and they will rob his property. What is this type of delusion called?
An 8-year-old child presents to the clinic with short stature. A growth hormone deficiency is suspected. Which of the following lab values is the most appropriate test to perform in this child?
A patient reports to the psychiatry ward with a firm belief that somebody wants to kill him. What is this type of delusion called?
High calcitonin levels with a nest of polygonal cells and amyloid deposits on cytology is seen in which of the following?
Which of the following changes is made to the dosage of levothyroxine for a pregnant woman in her 2nd trimester?
Which drug causes a decrease in insulin resistance by upregulating peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor gamma (PPAR-γ)?

The hypothalamus releases both stimulating and inhibiting hormones to control the secretions of the pituitary gland. Which of the following hormone released by the anterior pituitary is secreted by the pituitary gland in both males and females but is functional only in females under normal circumstances?
What is the main fatal outcome following botulinum toxin ingestion?

In a tutorial during a small group discussion, the facilitator was asking quiz regarding the gross and microscopic structure of the pituitary gland. Which hypophyseal structure receives signals from the hypothalamus via hypophyseal portal vessels?

A researcher wants to predict changes in systolic blood pressure with respect to the antihypertensive drug dosage that is prescribed. Which of the following analysis technique can help in predicting the change in SBP correctly?
Which of the following is the most appropriate test for neonatal screening of hypothyroidism?

answers.option: Total T4 and AMP: T3 levels

question: A 40-year-old male ingested Kuchila seeds (Stridnine nux vomica) for sexual wellness considering it to be a herbal medicine. What side effects will he experience considering he ingested the whole seed with pericarp?
Strychnine is known to hyper-stimulate the motor nervous system in the anterior horn cells of the spinal cord. What is the mechanism of action of strychnine?

answers.option: Blocks glycine uptake at neuromuscular junction

question: An overdose of aspirin would result in which of the following pH disturbance in a body at a later stage?
A large number of wedding guests experienced nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea following ingestion of meatballs at the ceremony waiting 4-6 hours. What type of food poisoning this could be?

A 16-year-old female came to the outpatient department with a painless swelling at her left breast which she noticed 6 months back. Upon examination, the lump is non-tender, and firm, at the 9 o'clock position, and is 3x2 cm. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old male is planning to undergo a total parathyroidectomy for multiple gland diseases. He shows concerns over the life-long management of postoperative hypocalcemia. How would you reassure the patient?

answers.option: Counsel regarding auto-transplantation of 50 mg of parathyroid tissue in brachioradialis
Counsel to make him believe that this is inevitable complication
Counsel regarding easy availability of calcium supplements
Counsel to get second opinion on surgery

question: A 50-year-old female presents with incidental finding of parathyroid adenoma on neck ultrasound. History and medical examination do not reveal any signs or symptoms however she insists on the removal of the adenoma. What criteria will justify parathyroidectomy in this patient?

answers.option: Decrease in serum calcium level of more than 5 mg/dl of upper normal limit

question: A 35-year-old female patient has a history of headaches with vomiting, vision disturbance, and galactorrhea. On examination, she has a loss of peripheral vision in both eyes. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 42-year-old lady has had a history of lethargy, lack of energy, amenorrhea, and loss of libido for the last year. On examination, she looks pale, with wrinkled skin, and low blood pressure. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old man presented in the outpatient department with muscle weakness, weight loss, extreme fatigue, peptic ulcereration, hypercalcemia, mood disturbances, and pathological fracture of the femur. Clinicians suspect primary hyperparathyroidism as a cause of his illness, what is the best diagnostic test to confirm hyperparathyroidism in this patient?
What is the best management option for treating primary hyperparathyroidism due to parathyroid adenoma?

A 57-year-old lady presented in the outpatient department with a complaint of frequent semi-solid stools and palpitation. She lost 8kg weight in the past 6 months. On examination, she has had lumpy bumpy painless swelling in her neck for 20 years. What would be the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old lady presented to the outpatient department with the complaint of an increase in appetite, weight loss and sweating for the past 3 months. She has a gritty sensation in her eyes. On examination, her hands are moist and warm. The thyroid gland is palpable with a bruit. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 26-year-old male patient with a history of depression complained of abdominal pain for the last 4 months, an account of 4 Kg weight loss, and the patient feels light headiness on walking. There is a history of abdominal tuberculosis for which he completed the treatment. On examination, the patient is anemic and their blood pressure is 90/60 mmHg. Lab results showed serum sodium of 129 mg/dl, potassium of 4.9 mg/dl, and creatinine of 1.0 mg/dl. What is the most likely investigation to confirm this diagnosis?

A 22-year-old female girl came to the outpatient department with complaints of fatigue, reduced stamina, weakness, anorexia, and weight loss in the last three months. On examination, there is an increased pigmentation on palmer creases. What is the most likely abnormality present in this patient?
A 56-year-old man was taking medications for osteoporosis secondary to hyperparathyroidism and recently was diagnosed with osteosarcoma. Which of the following medications he must be using?

A patient presented with a clinical presentation of secondary hyperparathyroidism with chronic renal failure. Endocrinologists decided to start a drug that works by mimicking the role of calcium in the blood and tricks the parathyroid gland into stopping secreting parathyroid hormone. Which of the following drugs performs the above-mentioned function?

A young married couple has been unable to conceive after 3 years of unprotected intercourse. The husband's sperm count is normal. They both agreed that they would like to get the wife's fertility treatment. Which of the following drugs has the ability to either stimulate or inhibit ovulation depending on the dosing schedule?

A 30-year-old woman was diagnosed with a case of hyperthyroidism due to graves disease. She looks healthy otherwise. In graves disease, the common cause of hyperthyroidism is the production of an antibody that causes which of the following?

answers.option: Stimulates pituitary thyrotropin releasing hormone and stimulates TSH release
Activates thyroid hormone receptors in peripheral tissues
Bind to thyroid gland thyroglobuline and increases the release of T3 and T4

question: A 55-years old woman with type 2 diabetes was going to start an oral antidiabetic drug that inhibits renal glucose reuptake from the filtrate, thus reducing blood glucose. Which of the following drugs can it be?

A 15-year-old boy with diabetes Melllitus type-1 was brought to the emergency department complaining of dizziness. Laboratory reports show severe hypoglycemia and ketoacidosis. Which of the following substances can be administered to achieve rapid control of severe ketoacidosis?

A 47-year-old man exhibited signs and symptoms of acromegaly. Radiological studies indicate the presence of a large pituitary tumor. Surgical treatment of this disease is only partially effective in controlling the disease. At this point, which of the following drugs is most likely to be used as a pharmacological therapy?

A 25-year-old female comes to the outpatient department with a complaint of inability to tolerate heat. She says she experiences excessive sweats and drastic weight loss. The physician found signs and symptoms of thyrotoxicosis and diagnosed it as primary hyperthyroidism. Which of the following accurately describes the lab findings in this patient?

answers.option: No change in the levels of TSH, T3 and T4
Low TSH, high T3 and T4

question: A 25-year-old woman ended up in the emergency department with fever, palpitations, excessive sweating, vomiting, and diarrhea. On investigation, her T3, and T4 was found to be significantly raised. A diagnosis of thyroid storm was made. This condition is associated with which of the following?

Parents of a 5-year-old boy noticed that he has developed features that suggest puberty over the past 6 months. On examination, the boy has secondary sex characteristics, including pubic hair, and enlargement of the penis. Which of the following morphological features is most likely to be seen in his adrenal glands?

A 45-year-old woman reports a feeling of fullness in her neck without any other complaints. This enlargement has been gradual and painless for more than 1 year. Physical examination confirms diffuse enlargement of the thyroid gland without any apparent masses. Laboratory studies of thyroid function show a normal free T4 level and a slightly increased TSH level. Imaging shows a solitary, spherical, encapsulated lesion that is demarcated from the surrounding thyroid parenchyma by a well-defined, intact capsule. What is the most likely cause of these findings?

A 55-year-old otherwise healthy man feels a small lump on the left side of his neck. His physician palpates a firm, painless, 2 cm cervical lymph node. The thyroid gland is not palpable. A chest radiograph is unremarkable. Laboratory findings include calcium of 9.1 mg/ dL, phosphorus is 3.3 mg/dL, thyroxine of 8.7 micrograms, and TSH is 2.3 mU/L. Hemoglobin, blood cells, and platelet count are normal. Fine needle aspiration of the thyroid gland was done and the following structures appeared under a microscope, "The nuclei of cells contain finely dispersed chromatin, which imparts an optically clear or empty appearance, giving rise to the ground-glass or Orphan Annie eye nuclei. In addition, invaginations of the cytoplasm give the appearance of intranuclear inclusions". What is the most likely diagnosis in this case?
A 40-years old male presented to the clinic with the complaint of polyuria, and polydipsia. His lab revealed an HBa1C of 6.1%. What is the interpretation of the results?

a 45-year-old patient comes to the outpatient department with headaches, dizziness, confusion, and irritability. The physician performs an eye examination and finds a loss of vision in the visual fields. What kind of visual field loss is observed in pituitary adenoma?

A researcher predicted a relationship between salt consumption in milligrams and a change in blood pressure in millimeters of mercury. considering the prediction equation y= a+bx. the change in the blood pressure in this equation is denoted by which of the following letters?

A 23-year-old woman with asthma started the therapy with budesonide, an inhaled steroid. The topical administration and short half-life greatly reduce the risk of systemic side effects compared with oral prednisone. The long-term daily administration of the therapeutic doses of prednisone results in which of the following?

answers.option: Increased male pattern hair growth in women
Hyperplasia of cells in zona fasciculata and reticularis of adrenal cortex

question: Which one of the following would be the most appropriate statistical test to compare the proportions for passing the annual exam among males and females undergraduates students?
The Chi-square test is the most appropriate statistical test to apply to a data set when the researcher wants to compare the difference between which of the following?

answers.option: Between more than two continuous variables

question: A 30-year-old female patient, obese, nondiabetic, presented with significant weight gain, easy fatiguability, and lethargy. On examination, she looked pale, obese, and slightly confused. Her blood pressure is 170/90 mmHg, and her pulse rate is 55 beats/min. She was unable to stand from a sitting position without support and her deep tendon reflexes were diminished. With the given scenario, what is the probable diagnosis?
Toxicity from which of the following drugs can cause a ringing sensation in the ears?

A 33-year-old mother of two children comes with a history of amenorrhea for 6 months. She is negative about pregnancy. For some days she is also experiencing increased milk production from her breasts along with a persistent headache. She also complains of visual disturbances. An optometrist finds her lateral vision reduced. On examination, she is afebrile and nonhypertensive. Which of the following laboratory findings is most likely to be present in this patient?

A 29-year-old primigravida with no prenatal care comes to the emergency department with vaginal bleeding after the onset of labor at 38 weeks, C-section for a lacerated low-lying placenta was performed. She remained hypotensive post-operatively for about 6 hours and was transfused with 12 units of packed RBCs. Now she is unable to feed her newborn and a normal menstrual cycle was not restored. Laboratory findings are hyponatremia, hypokalemia, and hypoglycemia. Which of the following pathological lesion is she most likely to have?

A 49-year-old female experienced multiple attacks of abdominal pain last year. Three times she had passed stones in the urine during these episodes of pain. Now she is experiencing pain in her right middle finger for one month. On physical examination, her finger is tender. Laboratory reports show calcium 13.7 mg/ dL, phosphate 1.9 mg/ dL, and Creatinine 1.1mg/ dL, albumin 4.8 mg/ dL. Which of the following bone lesions is she most likely to have?

A 12-year-old child presents with lethargy, constipation, and pain in calf for 3 months. On examination, he has protruded abdomen and coarse facial skin. Which is the single best investigation to confirm the diagnosis?

A farmer while spraying his fields fell suddenly ill and was brought to the emergency department, with complaints of nausea, dyspnea, abdominal cramps, chest pain, and blurred vision. Which of the following is the most accurate diagnosis in this case?

A 30-year-old female comes to the clinic with the complaint of painless swelling on the left side of the neck for 3 months. Detailed history and examination reveal she has palpitations, heat intolerance, sweating, and frequent diarrhea. Her pulse is 110 beats/min, blood pressure is 110/80 mmHg. Her palms are moist but no tremors are observed. There is about 4 x 4 cm, soft, non-tender, swelling present in the right lobe and isthmus, which is moving upon deglutition. Radioiodine shows homogenous uptake. She has decreased thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) levels with increased free T3 and T4 levels. What is the best treatment option for this case?

A 29-year-old patient comes with complaints of fever and sore throat. On examination, her throat is congested and her thyroid is palpable. She has no signs and symptoms of thyroid disease and neither has a positive family history. Labs reveal low TSH and T3 levels while her T4 is raised. What is the possible diagnosis?
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis if a technetium pertechnetate scan of a patient shows diffuse uptake of an isotope?

Which of the following is described as a powerful statistical method that allows you to examine the relationship between two or more variables of interest in which the influence of one or more independent variables on a dependent variable can be studied?
Which of the following secretes androgens?
Which of the following hormones does not use cyclic adenosine monophosphate (cAMP) as a second messenger?
Which of the following is the effect of propylthiouracil on thyroid hormone?

answers.option: Inhibits oxidation of iodide and coupling of iodine

question: Which of the following is a first-line treatment of primary hyperparathyroidism?

An 8-year-old child presents to the outpatient department for short height. His height is 106 cm, and his weight is 16 kg. He was normal at birth. He looks chubby and immature but with a normal IQ. Growth velocity is decreased. X-ray shows delayed bone age at 3 years. The most likely cause of short stature in this child would be which of the following?

A 15-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department with backache, moon face, muscle weakness, and truncal obesity. On examination, the child has elevated blood pressure and delayed reflexes. The laboratory results show increased cortisol levels. Which of the following hormones would be increased in the patient?

A 57-year-old woman presents with amenorrhea and emotional disturbances. She has upper truncal obesity. Laboratory results show elevated serum levels of cortisol, which can be lowered by the administration of dexamethasone. Which of the following is the most likely cause of hypercortisolism in this patient?
Which of the following is a corticosteroid of choice in Addison's disease?

A patient presented to the outpatient department with complaints of dysphagia, fatigue, weight loss, hypotension, abdominal pain, and hyperpigmentation at the areas exposed to sun and friction. Which of the following can be given in this case?
Glucocorticoid is given in adrenal hyperplasia to achieve which of the following?

Physical examination of an infant shows a markedly virilized and hypertrophic clitoris with partial fusion of the labioscrotal folds in a female having 46, XX karyotype. Laboratory studies will most likely reveal a deficiency of which of the following?

Acromegaly is a condition in which there is an excessive secretion of growth hormone in the body in adults. A patient with this condition can present with which of the following associated metabolic abnormalities?

A 16-year-old girl presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of severe acne, oily skin, excessive body hair, and primary amenorrhea. She also has an enlarged clitoris. Which of the following tests is not useful in making the diagnosis?
Which of the following statements is correct regarding the endocrine glands in the body?

answers.option: They are completely independent of nervous system

question: Which of the following is used in the treatment of Addison's disease?
Which of the following oral hypoglycemic drugs can cause an increased risk of hypoglycemia in a patient with renal impairment?
Which of the following is the most common adverse effect of tolbutamide when given in excess?
Which of the following is true regarding the effect of radioiodine on the thyroid parenchyma?

answers.option: Beta radiations mainly destroy the follicular cell
Both alpha particles and gamma rays destroy the parafollicular cells
Radioiodine has no effect on the thyroid parenchyma
Gamma radiation destroys the parafollicular cells
Alpha particles destroy the follicular cells

question: A 12-year-old child is diagnosed with candidiasis. His past medical history is significant for Addison's disease, hypoparathyroidism, and hypocalcemia. Which of the following conditions does the patient have?
Which of the following is the best management in case of snake bites in remote areas?

answers.option: Tie with tourniquet to stop blood
Suck the venom out using mouth or breast pump
Immobilize the arm and keep it below heart level

question: Which of the following accurately describes the manifestation of autoimmune hypothyroidism on lab investigations?
Which of the following is the most likely complication in a patient with diabetes mellitus for 11 years?

A 45-year-old female presents with a nodule in her thyroid region. Orphan Annie's eye nuclei and invaginations of the nuclear membrane are visible on the microscope. Fine needle aspiration of the nodule material shows psammoma bodies within the cores of papillae. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the most common endogenous cause of the Cushing syndrome?

A 56-year-old female patient who has a history of diabetes and hypertension starts taking amiodarone after her coronary artery bypass surgery. Later, she presents with symptoms of tiredness, sensitivity to cold, weight gain, and constipation. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient presents with the complaint that he gets dizzy and experiences blurred vision and fatigue within three minutes of standing up from a supine position. He is confirmed to have orthostatic hypotension. Physical examination reveals hyperpigmentation of palmar creases, nipples, and axillary region. Lab investigations reveal fasting hypoglycemia and hyponatremia. Which of the following can be given to manage this patient?

answers.option: Many small meals to overcome hypoglycemia

question: A patient having hypertension, hyperglycemia, and truncal obesity is diagnosed as a case of Cushing syndrome following a dexamethasone test. What is the most likely cause of hypercortisolism if serum ACTH is below normal?

A young female presented with fever, palpitations, increased sweating, and weight loss. On examination, she has tachycardia and mild painful swelling in the neck. What is your clinical impression if thyroid scintigraphy shows low uptake thyrotoxicosis?
Patients presented to the outpatient department with low blood pressure of 90/60 mmHg, hyponatremia, and hyperkalemia. Which of the following is directly or indirectly responsible for this condition?
Growth hormone which is used for therapeutic purposes is derived from which of the following sources?
Which of the following can be used to check the linearity of data in the SPSS software?
A patient with hyperparathyroidism develops urinary calculi. What will be the treatment of hyperparathyroidism in this patient?
Which of the following tests determines the difference between the observed and expected data for a group?
You have to counsel a diabetic patient about regular checking of his foot. Which of the following is the best statement for the patient?

answers.option: You should do it otherwise you will get an amputation
Get your foot checked if you find it ischemic or gangrenic
You have to check daily if the foot hurts
You should do it because regular foot examinations with optimal glycemic control can prevent foot ulceration
You just have to do it

question: Which of the following tests can determine the difference in distribution between two or more categorical variables?

A researcher wants to find out the difference in the intensity of stress between three groups of factory workers. The variables being used are continuous. Which of the following tests can be used in this case?
Which of the following tests can be used in the study to compare the difference between groups and within groups to find out if they're statistically significant or not?

A 35-year-old lady presented to the outpatient department with the complaint of an increase in appetite, weight loss, and sweating for the past 3 months. She has a gritty sensation in her eyes. On examination, her hands are moist and warm. The thyroid gland is palpable with a bruit. Which of the following is not a treatment option in this case?

A person presented to the outpatient department with hypertension, hypernatremia, and hypokalemia. His BUN was 26 mg/dl and serum creatinine was 1.3 mg/dl. What can be the possible cause of these presentations if Cushing's syndrome is ruled out?

A child presents to the emergency department with complaints of vomiting, seizures, and respiratory distress after having eaten a sausage. Upon physical examination, there is a descending symmetric flaccid paralysis of voluntary muscles and loss of deep tendon reflexes. Which of the following can be the cause of these symptoms?
Which of the following tests can be done to investigate a radiologically suspicious solitary cervical nodule of 2 cm that moves with deglutition?
Metformin can not be given to a diabetic patient with an addiction to alcohol as it will increase the chances of which of the following?
Which of the following is the class of insulin receptors?
